Rich is right.  Clearly someone is taking your content as their own, 
and t=
he only other section is a programmer's website design 
recommendations.

I=
 find content from my site popping up all over the internet.  In 
those few=
 instances where I have asked the party to remove, or 
otherwise cite satch=
o.com as the source, the request is often 
ignored.  Twice I have been told=
 by (well known) sites owners' that a 
third party who listed the stolen co=
ntent did so without their 
knowledge.  Then in the most regulated of perfe=
ct worlds - the eBay 
utopia with its guardians of what is fine, good, and =
proper, the 
auction ends well before receiving a dismissive and self-servi=
ng, 
automated reply from the eBay to my inquiry.

Ken - I enjoy your inter=
esting - and novel - site documenting the 
study of the mantis theme in tsu=
ba, and hope that it continues 
undeterred.



Michael Harris
